reviewText:
This is a fun series to watch especially around Halloween. Interesting ghost stories and filled with fun haunted facts! It's not HD quality and is from the early 2000's. Some (not all) have been burned on wrightable disks so they have generic sleeves as pictured (left) . Some have The original sleeve as pictured (right).All my disks have worked fine.
I wish History Channel still had documentaries like this. I have the entire collection and would recommend it!

I love Colorado and the Rocky Mountains! Even when you enter into the mountains, you can feel the ghosts of the past welcoming you! This DVD offers a little history into the Rocky Mountains. You won't regret buying it! I love my copy!
I use to watch it on history channel

When one thinks of "The Rockies" you would be thinking of Colorado for a fact. Most of these stories I found to be very interesting and informative to say the least. The segments mentioned are ~
~ Buckskin Joe, Co. Named after said person and the Mines that helped develop the town
~ The Hanging Barn
~ Manitou Springs
 ** Emma Crawford, A Pianist/Spiritualist and well respected woman of the town. When she died, her wish was to be buried on top of "Red Mtn.".
Later years had her resting place disturbed by developers and her remains were found and later reburied in the town cemetery. She haunts it and perhaps the very place on the Mtn. where her grave was disturbed. The town holds local parades and charity races in her honor.
** The Crawford House is discussed
~ 1890 Pikes Peak, "Womack" struck Gold.
~ "Cripple Creek" Gold Mines
~ Palace Hotel
~ 1886 Molly Tobin, Leadville, Colorado
~ Molly would later marry a man with wealth, a man who either owned a Goldmine or was a benefactor of such.
~ 1894 "Molly Brown" moved to Capitol Hill, Denver. A very prestigious locale for the times.
~ April, 1912, took maiden voyage on the "Titanic". Survived. The Newspapers had noted Molly singing with the ladies in her boat to keep spirits up.
~ Her and her husband J.J. separate in 1920.
~ He later dies of Heart Failure in 1922.
~ Molly Brown dies of Stroke in NY Hotel in 1932.
~ 1971, The "Molly Brown" House Museum is opened. It is haunted according to guests and employees.
~ Estes Park, Colorado, "The Stanley Hotel", built in 1897, it served as a model for the movie "The Shining".
Well done edition! Good picture and good narration! Recommended!
The History Channel put out a fantastic set of programs of Paranormal occurrences around the world. The "Haunted Histories" are a collection of these stories. I really wish they had done more.
